description:
Aspose.Pdf for .NET is a PDF document creation and manipulation component that enables your .NET applications to read, write and manipulate existing PDF documents without using Adobe Acrobat. It also allows you to create forms and manage form fields embedded in a PDF document. This component is written in managed C# and it allows developers to add PDF creation and manipulation functionality to their Microsoft .NET applications (WinForms, ASP.NET and .NET Compact Framework).
        Aspose.Pdf for .NET is affordable and offers an incredible wealth of features including PDF compression options; table creation and manipulation; support for graph objects; extensive hyperlink functionality; extended security controls; custom font handling; integration with data sources; add or remove bookmarks; create table of contents; add, update, delete attachments and annotations; import or export PDF form data; add, replace or remove text and images; split, concatenate, extract or inset pages; transform pages to image; print PDF documents and much more.
releaseNotes:
This release introduces the features, enhancements and bug fixes as detailed below:
		
Features
PDFNEWNET-38508	Support Replaceable Symbols in DOM

Enhancements
PDFNEWNET-39724	Aspose.Pdf XML Schema for new generator issue
PDFNEWNET-39642	Using Roman numbers in TOC entries
PDFNEWNET-39481	Spacing between heading text and labels
PDFNEWNET-39455	API does not add Document-level JavaScript
PDFNEWNET-39664 Change TOC page location number to other than first page

Exceptions
PDFNEWNET-38712	PDF.ColumnAdjustment.AutoFitToContent throws error
PDFNEWNET-38629	MHT to PDF - Exception during conversion
PDFNEWNET-38071	Exception while filling form field
PDFNEWNET-39974	ProcessParagraphs does not work for Page object
PDFNEWNET-39969	Invalid Index Range Exception with font size of footnotes
PDFNEWNET-39520	Flattening PDF file throws NullReferenceException
PDFNEWNET-39276	PDF to HTML conversion throws ArgumentException
PDFNEWNET-38853	XML to PDF conversion throws ArgumentException

Bugs
PDFNEWNET-39526	Placing nested tables on same page generate error when viewing document
PDFNEWNET-39498	PDF to PDF/A - Resultant file is not PDF/A_1b compliant
PDFNEWNET-39282	Adding TOC removes top page region
PDFNEWNET-38961	Application hangs while flattening PDF form fields
PDFNEWNET-38929	Row is being rendered in new page when using IsRowBroken property
PDFNEWNET-38522	Image to PDF - Evaluation watermark appears when setting IsBlackWhite as True
PDFNEWNET-38190	Line breaks being ignored from a cdata field
PDFNEWNET-38122	HTML to PDF - Some contents are not rendered in resultant file
PDFNEWNET-37078	FieldNames cannot be found in PDF form
PDFNEWNET-39987	Issue while adding two Graph objects in a Page
PDFNEWNET-39962	PDF to HTML conversion process prints unnecessary console messages
PDFNEWNET-39957	Large or many footnote positioning issue
PDFNEWNET-39946	Aspose PDF Footnote overlaps Footer
PDFNEWNET-39749	HtmlFragment and Images are not working together
PDFNEWNET-39748	Change Paragraph background color spans over multiple pages
PDFNEWNET-39547	PDF is not converted to PDFA (SB-C521P001_00_S1KD.PDF)
PDFNEWNET-39433	PDF to PDFA: compliance failure of resultant PDFA1b
PDFNEWNET-39369	PDF to HTML conversion throws ArgumentException
PDFNEWNET-39365	Adding TOC crops the page area larger than A4 in resultant PDF
PDFNEWNET-39344	PDF is not converted to PDFA
PDFNEWNET-39068	Cannot add new section after a multi-columns section
PDFNEWNET-38909	PDF to PDFA: Annotations are deleted
PDFNEWNET-38611	Pdf to Html CSS Prefix Problem
PDFNEWNET-37959	Image margin issue
PDFNEWNET-37385	Footnotes are overlapping
PDFNEWNET-35716	Large TIff to PDF conversion issue
PDFNEWNET-39292	Text breaks after HtmlFragment in 10.7.0
PDFNEWNET-38088 HTML to PDF - The conversion process continues forever
PDFNEWNET-39397 System.NullReferenceException: PdfFileInfo is not initialized
PDFNEWNET-38873 PDF to DOCX - Loosing some text in resultant file
PDFNEWNET-38382 Problem with table calculations.
PDFNEWNET-39135 PDF to PDF/A - Resultant file is not PDF/A compliant
PDFNEWNET-39617 PDF to PDFA2A compliance failure
PDFNEWNET-39618 PDF to PDF/A_2A or PDF/A_3A - Resultant file is not defined as pdfa compliance
PDFNEWNET-39467 PDF to PDFA1b: resultant PDF does not claim PDFA compliance
PDFNEWNET-39468 PDF to PDFA: resultant PDFA loses the text formatting and has incorrect characters
summary: Aspose.Pdf for .NET is an amazing component which provides the feature to create and manipulate PDF documents.
title: Aspose.Pdf for .NET
